text: Ľubica (, , ) is a large village and municipality in Kežmarok District in the Prešov Region of north Slovakia. It is now a mostly housing development district with many panel block houses. ==History== In historical records the village was first mentioned in 1271. The village was formerly known as Leibitz, as a city of Czechoslovakia (1946 - 1990), and previously of Hungary (1000 - 1946)."Leibitz". We Relate (April 12, 2015). Martin Luther's Ninety- Five Theses were first read publicly in Ľubica in 1521 by Thomas Preisner.Daniel 1992, p. 56. ==Geography== The municipality lies at an altitude of 630 metres and covers an area of 26.421 km². It has a population of about 4,507 people. ==References== == External links == * Category:Villages and municipalities in Kežmarok District
title: Ľubica
